Q&A.Q: What are the eligibility criteria for BTech admission at this university?
Q&A.A: Candidates must have passed Class 12 or equivalent with a minimum of 45% aggregate marks in Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/Computer Science/Electronics, with English as one of the languages of study. They should be at least 17 years old as of 31st December of the admission year.

Q&A.Q: How can candidates apply for the NUCAT exam?
Q&A.A: Candidates can apply for the NUCAT exam by completing and submitting the Online NUCAT registration form available at apply.nitte.edu.in.

Q&A.Q: What scholarships are available for NUCAT toppers?
Q&A.A: Toppers in NUCAT can avail scholarships ranging from 20%-40% of the prescribed fee.

Q&A.Q: Who falls under the NRI category for BTech admission?
Q&A.A: Foreign Nationals, PIOs, Overseas Citizens of India, candidates who passed Class 12 outside India, and those sponsored by parents/blood relatives having NRI status fall under the NRI category.

Q&A.Q: How are seats allocated for NRI category candidates?
Q&A.A: Seats are allocated based on the marks secured in the optional subjects in the qualifying examination for NRI category candidates.

Q&A.Q: What documents are required for BTech admission?
Q&A.A: Documents required include 10th and 12th standard pass certificates, transfer certificate, conduct certificate, migration certificate, eligibility certificate issued by Nitte University, physical fitness certificate, blood group certificate, Aadhaar card copy, and photographs.

Q&A.Q: Are there any additional documents required for NRI candidates?
Q&A.A: Yes, additional documents for NRI candidates include valid Passport & Visa of parent/sponsor, residence proof, employment certificate of parent/sponsor, sponsorship certificate, and relationship certificate.

Q&A.Q: What is the commencement period for BTech classes?
Q&A.A: The BTech classes typically commence in July/August as prescribed by the University.

Q&A.Q: How can I check the fee structure for BTech programs?
Q&A.A: The fee structure for both General & NRI categories can be found on the university's website under 'Program Fee'.

Q&A.Q: Is there any age limit for BTech admission?
Q&A.A: Yes, candidates should have completed 17 years of age as on 31st December of the admission year.

Q&A.Q: Can I apply for BTech admission if I have studied Class 12 outside India?
Q&A.A: Yes, candidates who have studied Class 12 outside India are eligible for BTech admission.

Q&A.Q: What is the minimum aggregate percentage required for BTech admission?
Q&A.A: Candidates must have a minimum aggregate of 45% marks in Class 12 or equivalent.

Q&A.Q: Is there an entrance exam for NRI category candidates?
Q&A.A: No, NRI category candidates are admitted based on marks secured in the optional subjects in the qualifying examination.

Q&A.Q: How many passport size photographs are required for admission?
Q&A.A: Five recent color photos with a white background (35mm x 45mm) and five stamp size photos (20mm x 25mm) are required for admission.

Q&A.Q: Can I pay the fees in foreign currency for NRI category admission?
Q&A.A: Yes, fees can be paid in foreign currency or INR from the NRE account of the sponsor for NRI category admission.

Q&A.Q: What is the process for obtaining an eligibility certificate from Nitte University?
Q&A.A: The process for obtaining an eligibility certificate will be handled by Nitte University.

Q&A.Q: How can I submit the admission enquiry form for NRI category admission?
Q&A.A: Candidates seeking admission under the NRI category can submit the Admission Enquiry form available on apply.nitte.edu.in.

Q&A.Q: What is the last date for submitting the NUCAT registration form?
Q&A.A: The last date for submitting the NUCAT registration form will be mentioned on the university's website.

Q&A.Q: Can candidates with a compartment in Class 12 apply for BTech admission?
Q&A.A: Candidates must have passed Class 12 without any compartments to be eligible for BTech admission.

Q&A.Q: Is there any relaxation in eligibility criteria for reserved category candidates?
Q&A.A: The university follows the eligibility criteria strictly, but candidates may refer to the official notification for any relaxation provided for reserved categories.

Q&A.Q: Can I apply for BTech admission if I have pursued a vocational stream in Class 12?
Q&A.A: Yes, candidates from vocational streams are eligible for BTech admission provided they meet the other eligibility criteria.

Q&A.Q: Can candidates with a gap year apply for BTech admission?
Q&A.A: Yes, candidates with a gap year can apply for BTech admission, provided they meet the eligibility criteria.

Q&A.Q: Can candidates from Arts or Commerce streams apply for BTech admission?
Q&A.A: Candidates from Arts or Commerce streams are not eligible for BTech admission. They must have studied Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/Computer Science/Electronics in Class 12.

Q&A.Q: Can I apply for BTech admission if I have studied in a foreign board?
Q&A.A: Yes, candidates who have studied in a foreign board are eligible for BTech admission, provided they meet the other eligibility criteria.

Q&A.Q: What is the mode of the NUCAT entrance exam?
Q&A.A: The mode of the NUCAT entrance exam may be online or offline, as per the notification released by the university.

Q&A.Q: How can I obtain the migration certificate from the Board of the last studied institution?
Q&A.A: The migration certificate can be obtained from the Board of the last studied institution by submitting the necessary documents and application form.

Q&A.Q: Can candidates with a gap year apply for the scholarship?
Q&A.A: Yes, candidates with a gap year can apply for the scholarship if they meet the eligibility criteria specified by the university.

Q&A.Q: How can I obtain the physical fitness certificate from a registered medical practitioner?
Q&A.A: The physical fitness certificate can be obtained by undergoing a medical examination by a registered medical practitioner and submitting the prescribed format.

Q&A.Q: Can candidates with a diploma apply for lateral entry into the BTech program?
Q&A.A: Yes, candidates with a diploma can apply for lateral entry into the BTech program, subject to fulfilling the eligibility criteria set by the university.

Q&A.Q: How can I obtain the relationship certificate for NRI category admission?
Q&A.A: The relationship certificate can be obtained from the appropriate authority by submitting the necessary documents and application form.

Q&A.Q: Are there any specific requirements for the photographs submitted for admission?
Q&A.A: The photographs submitted for admission should be recent, with a white background and the specified dimensions.
